alert.note: Alert for Lincoln; Wayne (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 12 at 11:43AM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Lawrence, west central Lincoln and central Wayne Counties through 1215 PM EST... At 1143 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Ulysses, or 9 miles south of Louisa, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Louisa, Wayne, Fort Gay, Ulysses, East Lynn Lake, Charley, Kiahsville, Dunlow, Gallup, Clifford, Glenhayes, East Lynn and Genoa. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 400 PM EST for northeastern Kentucky...and western West Virginia.
